events.message: The customer reported their vehicle was involved in a collision with another car on Main Street, resulting in significant damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and damage description provided by the customer.
An agent with experience in auto accident claims was assigned to manage the case and coordinate further communication.
The insurer sent a confirmation acknowledging receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining the next steps required.
The customer was asked to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of their driverâ€™s license for documentation.
The customer provided all requested documents including clear images of the damaged vehicle and the official police report.
An investigation was initiated to evaluate the circumstances of the collision and verify the details reported by the customer.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the other party was responsible for the accident.
An initial settlement proposal was made covering repairs to the vehicle and rental car expenses for the customer.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was formally approved to proceed with payment for repairs as outlined in the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customer's account to cover vehicle repairs and additional expenses.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation that repairs were completed and the customer is satisfied with resolution.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely in compliance with company record-keeping policies.
